value.title: Trump aides pound on China. Health experts say: Please stop.

value.title: China Sidesteps Spokesman's Claim of U.S. Role in Coronavirus Outbreak
value.excerpt: Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Geng Shuang sidestepped questions on Friday about whether Beijing blames the United States for the coronavirus, a day after another spokesman suggested the U.S. army could have planted it.

value.title: Coronavirus: First COVID-19 case can be traced back to Nov 17 in China’s Hubei province, says report
value.excerpt: The first case of novel coronavirus can be traced back to November 17 last year in China's Hubei province, which subsequently became its epicentre as it rapidly spread at home and abroad before Chinese health officials could identify the deadly virus, according to a media report. The first case of novel coronavirus can be traced back to ...

value.title: Kazakhstan confirms first coronavirus cases
value.excerpt: NUR-SULTAN (Reuters) - Two Kazakh citizens have tested positive for coronavirus after returning from Germany, Healthcare Minister Yelzhan Birtanov said on Friday, the first cases of the disease in the Central Asian country. The patients are staying in a specialized hospital in Almaty, Kazakhstan’s biggest city, he told a briefing.

images.title: Kazakhstan confirms first coronavirus cases

value.title: UPDATE 1-Singapore to close mosques to prevent coronavirus spread
value.excerpt: SINGAPORE, March 12- Singapore will close all mosques for at least five days for deep cleaning to prevent the spread of coronavirus after two congregants were thought to have been infected during an Islamic conference in neighbouring Malaysia.

images.title: UPDATE 1-Singapore to close mosques to prevent coronavirus spread

value.title: Japan approves emergency powers for PM to tackle coronavirus outbreak
value.excerpt: Japan’s parliament on Friday approved a bill giving Prime Minister Shinzo Abe emergency powers that will let him close schools, halt large gatherings and requisition medical supplies as Japan tries to slow the coronavirus outbreak.

images.title: Japan approves emergency powers for PM to tackle coronavirus outbreak

value.title: India ready to take steps to calm markets over coronavirus, says adviser
value.excerpt: The Indian government and financial regulators will take necessary steps to calm markets gripped by fears over coronavirus, the government’s chief economic adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian said on Friday.

value.title: Coronavirus-Driven Rate-Cutting Is Less Likely in Japan
value.excerpt: The Bank of Japan is hesitant to join the Fed and other central banks in cutting interest rates because its target is already below zero, and it wants to focus on supporting companies affected by the novel coronavirus,

value.title: Japan Airlines To Cut 1,488 Flights From March 16 -28 Over Coronavirus Concerns
value.excerpt: (RTTNews) - Japan Airlines Co., Ltd. (JAPSY.OB) announced Friday its decision to temporarily reduce domestic services between March 16 and March 28 in response to the Coronavirus or COVID-19 outbreak. From March 16 through March 19, the company will reduce 20 flights, while March 20 through March 28, it will temporarily cut 1,468 domestic flights.

value.title: Live updates: Coronavirus hits Asian markets, as schools, sports, events shut down in U.S.
value.excerpt: The specter of prolonged economic dislocation gripped the world on Friday, as more events were canceled due to the coronavirus, Asian markets slumped and President Trump publicly pondered whether the Tokyo Olympics might be postponed. Public life across the United States appeared to be grinding to a halt. Broadway went dark, major theme parks ...

value.title: Bob Dylan concerts in Japan canceled as coronavirus spreads
value.excerpt: Bob Dylan’s upcoming concerts in Japan have been canceled because of the coronavirus outbreak, the tour organizer said on Friday. The American singer-songwriter was due to perform 15 concerts in Tokyo and Osaka in April.

images.title: Bob Dylan concerts in Japan canceled as coronavirus spreads

value.title: City of Yichang in China's Hubei eases travel curbs against coronavirus
value.excerpt: China’s city of Yichang in central Hubei province will loosen travel curbs adopted to rein in a coronavirus outbreak, allowing people to move in and out, the government said on Friday, in a statement on its website.

images.title: City of Yichang in China's Hubei eases travel curbs against coronavirus

value.title: Coronavirus: First death confirmed in India
value.excerpt: India has recorded its first death linked to the coronavirus, officials have confirmed. The 76-year-old man, from the southern state of Karnataka, returned from Saudi Arabia on 29 February after a month-long visit. People who came in contact with the man, who died on Tuesday, are being traced and quarantined, the state's health minister said.

images.title: Coronavirus: First death confirmed in India

value.title: China's coronavirus center of Wuhan sees single-digit new cases for second day
value.excerpt: China’s Wuhan city, ground zero of the new coronavirus outbreak, reported five new cases on Friday, the second day in a row the tally has been less than 10, while no locally transmitted infections were reported in the rest of the country.

images.title: China's coronavirus center of Wuhan sees single-digit new cases for second day

value.title: China says COVID-19 has peaked; new restrictions in Italy, Saudi Arabia, Venezuela
value.excerpt: Beijing on Thursday declared the coronavirus outbreak has peaked in China, as new cases in the Wuhan epicenter declined to single digits. Meanwhile, cases continued to climb in Europe and Iran.

images.title: China says COVID-19 has peaked; new restrictions in Italy, Saudi Arabia, Venezuela

value.title: Japan's Olympics minister reaffirms no delay over coronavirus
value.excerpt: TOKYO, Japan — Japan's Olympics minister has brushed off President Donald Trump's suggestion the Tokyo Olympics be postponed. Olympic minister Seiko Hashimoto told a news conference Friday that the International Olympic Committee and Japanese organizers are “not considering cancellation or a postponement, absolutely not at all.”

images.title: Japan's Olympics minister reaffirms no delay over coronavirus

value.title: Trump says still ‘lots of options’ for Tokyo Olympics, after call with Japan’s Abe
value.excerpt: TOKYO — President Trump praised Japan's preparations for the Summer Olympics and said there were still "lots of options" for holding the Games, only hours after suggesting they might have to be postponed for a year due to the coronavirus outbreak.

images.title: Trump says still ‘lots of options’ for Tokyo Olympics, after call with Japan’s Abe

value.title: Japan Airlines to cut 1,468 domestic flights group-wide from March 20-28
value.excerpt: Japan Airlines Co said on Friday it would reduce 1,468 flights on 60 domestic routes across the group between March 20-28, citing a drop in demand due to cancellations and delays of sporting and cultural events amid the coronavirus outbreak.

value.title: Mainland China reports eight new confirmed cases of coronavirus

value.title: Japan's Power Demand Hit by Coronavirus Outbreak: Industry Head
value.excerpt: Japan's power demand has been hit by a slowdown in industrial activity due to the coronavirus outbreak, Japanese utilities federation's head said on Friday, without giving specific figures.

value.title: Asian markets plummet after Wall Street’s worst day since ’87
value.excerpt: Shares plunged in Asia early Friday, with Japan’s benchmark sinking as much as 10% after Wall Street suffered its biggest drop since the Black Monday crash of 1987. value.excerpt: An editorial in the official China Daily on Friday intensified a war of words with the United States, blasting “China-bashers” and saying they would “continue to fling dirt at China” despite what it called the country’s effective pandemic-control efforts.

value.title: Lower Open Anticipated For Hong Kong Shares
value.excerpt: (RTTNews) - The Hong Kong stock market has finished lower in two straight sessions, plunging more than 1,080 points or 4.1 percent along the way. The Hang Seng Index now rests just above the 24,300-point plateau and it's expected to see further downside again on Friday.

images.title: Lower Open Anticipated For Hong Kong Shares
